title: How to Make Traditional Victoria Sponge Cake

steps.headline: Heat the oven to 190°C / fan 170°C or Gas Mark 5.
Butter or use non-stick spray on two 20cm round tins or whatever tin you have.
steps.description:
If you only have one big tin, bake the cake and cut it in half horizontally. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/a2\/Make-Traditional-Victoria-Sponge-Cake-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-Traditional-Victoria-Sponge-Cake-Step-3-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/a2\/Make-Traditional-Victoria-Sponge-Cake-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-Traditional-Victoria-Sponge-Cake-Step-3-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":307,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":507.3626373626374,"licensing":"

steps.headline: Mix together the butter and sugar to a nice creamy smooth batter.
Add the eggs and vanilla extract.
Add in the flour.
steps.description: (If you are using self-raising flour there is no need to add baking powder/soda)

steps.headline: Add in half a teaspoon of salt.
Split the batter between the two cake tins.
steps.description: If you are only using one tin, put it all in that tin.

steps.headline: Bake for around 20 minutes or until golden brown.
Leave the cake in its tin or on a cooling rack to cool completely.
Get your fresh cream or use buttercream using butter and icing sugar with drop of vanilla extract.
Cover the top of the first cake with your desired cream and add a thick layer of jam.
Layer the second cake on top of the first.
Dust with icing sugar and stick a few strawberries on top using fresh or butter cream.
Seal in an airtight container and consume within two days.

text:
Making the Cake Heat the oven to 190°C / fan 170°C or Gas Mark 5. Butter or use non-stick spray on two 20cm round tins or whatever tin you have. If you only have one big tin, bake the cake and cut it in half horizontally. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/a2\/Make-Traditional-Victoria-Sponge-Cake-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-Traditional-Victoria-Sponge-Cake-Step-3-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/a2\/Make-Traditional-Victoria-Sponge-Cake-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-Traditional-Victoria-Sponge-Cake-Step-3-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":307,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":507.3626373626374,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Mix together the butter and sugar to a nice creamy smooth batter. Add the eggs and vanilla extract. Add in the flour. (If you are using self-raising flour there is no need to add baking powder/soda) Add in half a teaspoon of salt. Split the batter between the two cake tins. If you are only using one tin, put it all in that tin. Bake for around 20 minutes or until golden brown. Leave the cake in its tin or on a cooling rack to cool completely. Making the Filling Get your fresh cream or use buttercream using butter and icing sugar with drop of vanilla extract. Cover the top of the first cake with your desired cream and add a thick layer of jam. Layer the second cake on top of the first. Dust with icing sugar and stick a few strawberries on top using fresh or butter cream. Seal in an airtight container and consume within two days.
